demographics.name: Carlos Jones
demographics.supportServices: Social Work consult placed; Referred to Lymphedema specialist.
demographics.mobility: Ambulatory with some difficulty due to significant lower extremity lymphedema and pain.

diagnosis.sitesOfInvolvement: Multiple cutaneous lesions (lower extremities, trunk, face - esp. LLE most bothersome), oral lesions (palate - painful), bilateral lower extremity edema.
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Cosmetically bothersome skin lesions, painful oral lesions affecting eating, significant leg swelling/pain (lymphedema).
diagnosis.histology: Spindle cell proliferation, vascular slits, extravasated erythrocytes. LANA-1 (HHV-8) positive.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: Newly diagnosed HIV, started on Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) recently.

treatmentPlan.intent: Palliative (Symptom control, Disease stabilization, Improve QoL)
treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) concurrent with Systemic Therapy and ART
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: Palate: 20 Gy / 5 fx; LLE: 8 Gy / 1 fx

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Two separate setups: 1) Supine with head mask for palate. 2) Supine with leg immobilization for LLE.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Mask marks for palate setup; clinical skin markings for LLE electron field.
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV contrast for head/neck portion to delineate anatomy.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT simulation of two distinct sites for palliative RT planning.

dosimetry.rx: Multiple Sites: Palate 20 Gy/5 fx; LLE 8 Gy/1 fx
dosimetry.planNotes: Palliative RT to two symptomatic sites. Simple, effective plans for symptom control.

fractions.setupNotes: Treated both palate (opposed lats) and LLE (direct electron) fields. Setup verified.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerated first fraction of multi-site RT well.

reportDetails.specimen: Punch Biopsy, Left Lower Leg Skin Lesion
reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Dermal proliferation of spindle cells forming slit-like vascular spaces containing extravasated red blood cells. Moderate nuclear atypia. Positive immunohistochemical staining for CD31, CD34, and LANA-1 (HHV-8). Negative for S100, Melan-A.

imagingAndReports.summary: Lungs are clear. No evidence of pulmonary KS.

reportDetails.findings: Lungs are clear bilaterally without consolidation, effusion, or pneumothorax. Cardiac silhouette is normal in size. Mediastinal contours are unremarkable.
reportDetails.impression: No acute cardiopulmonary process. No radiographic evidence of pulmonary Kaposi Sarcoma.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Oncology)
progressNotes.summary: Discussed diagnosis of advanced HIV-associated KS (T1I1S0). Recommended systemic therapy with Liposomal Doxorubicin given symptomatic disease. Patient agrees to plan. Will coordinate closely with ID. Referred to Radiation Oncology for evaluation of painful oral lesions and bothersome LLE lesions.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Samuel Chen (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt referred for consideration of palliative RT for symptomatic KS lesions. Examined oral cavity and LLE lesions. Plan: Palliative EBRT to hard palate (20 Gy in 5 fx) and to LLE lesions (8 Gy in 1 fx). Discussed potential side effects including oral mucositis and skin reaction. Consent obtained.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Anita Desai (Infectious Disease)
progressNotes.summary: Patient recently started on Biktarvy for HIV. Tolerating well. Labs show improvement in CD4 count and decrease in VL. Continue ART during chemo/RT. Monitor closely for IRIS and OIs. Started Bactrim prophylaxis.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Palliate symptoms from painful oral and skin lesions, and control overall disease with systemic chemotherapy.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: RT side effects: temporary mouth sores (mucositis) and skin redness/peeling at treated sites. Chemo side effects: fatigue, nausea, low blood counts, potential cardiac effects.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of oral hygiene during palate radiation. Skin care for leg lesion. Reporting signs of infection (fever) due to both HIV and chemotherapy.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend all appointments for RT and chemo. Adhere strictly to ART regimen. Report new or worsening symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Take all medications (ART, supportive care meds) as prescribed.

cptCharges.description: Therapeutic radiology simulation-aided field setting; simple
Radiation treatment delivery, superficial and/or ortho voltage
Injection, doxorubicin hydrochloride, liposomal, Doxil, 10 mg
